intro: Melampyrum subalpinum subsp. grandiflorum, commonly known as the alpine touch-me-not, is a flowering plant native to mountainous regions of Europe. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes, often in alpine meadows and open slopes. Its subspecies status reflects its distinct floral and ecological traits compared to other members of the Melampyrum genus.
